intro: Nototriche carabayensis, commonly known as the Carabaya nototriche, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible seeds. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped with a prominent midrib and a hairy surface. Nototriche carabayensis is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats.
